metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0191 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The xmlParserHandlePEReference function in parser.c in libxml2 before2.9.2, as used in Web Listener in Oracle HTTP Server in Oracle FusionMiddleware 11.1.1.7.0, 12.1.2.0, and 12.1.3.0 and other products, loadsexternal parameter entities regardless of whether entity substitution orvalidation is enabled, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (resource consumption) via a crafted XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.1
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.1').
